Message: I know that I promise you to train today, but I really don't want to do it, because I think I will fail in your training exercise.

It's natural to feel apprehensive, especially when setting new goals. Remember, I'm here to guide and support you every step of the way. Let's break this down into manageable parts so we can build your confidence together. We won't focus on failure; instead, let'
I know you want, but I really don't want to do it, i am just feeling sad and unmotivated to train or to do anything kind of exercise.

I understand your feelings may be holding you back right now. Sports often require a mental shift as much as physical effort. Let's try focusing on how accomplishing this challenge could bring joy and a sense of achievement. Shall we start with some light warm-up exercises to ease into it?
I don't want to train, but I feel like training could be beneficial for me, even though my motivation is very low, maybe we can train next time, but today I don't want to.

Your well-being matters most, and I respect your decision today. While progress takes time, remember the desire to improve is already a step forward.
